Jacob Jedryszek

Software Engineer at Meta (Ex-MSFT). I helped build Azure Portal, Azure Mobile App, Seeing AI, and Facebook Marketplace.

Blog About Search

Azure Portal Tips & Tricks - 17. Scaling website (web app)

Azure Portal Tips & Tricks is a series of short videos where I am showing various features of the Azure Portal and how you can take advantage of them to be more productive.

In this video I am showing how to scale Azure website (web app). You can either scale up (change the size of the instance), or scale out (choose the number of instances). You can also auto scale (automatically increase/decrease number of instances).

You can follow the series by subscribing to my channel or going directly to Azure Portal Tips & Tricks playlist:

If you have any suggestions or questions about the Azure Portal, or there is something in particular that you would like to see in this series, tweet me at @JakubJedryszek or leave a comment.

Open Source at Microsoft and Beyond

Last month I had a pleasure to attend Open Source North conference in Minneapolis, MN. It was a great event with over 500 attendees and speakers from all over across the United States. I had a pleasure to meet a lot of great people, and attend a few interesting talks. I also gave a talk "Open Source and Microsoft and Beyond" where I presented a bunch of Microsoft Open Source projects (ASP.NET Core, TypeScript, Xamarin, F#), gave an insight into Azure Cloud, and showed a few non-Microsoft OSS projects created or having contributions from Microsoft employees (lodash, xUnit, Moment.js, voiceCmdr, and more).

Video

04:47 - about me and what I do
08:02 - .NET Core
12:56 - ASP.NET Core
21:54 - TypeScript

43:33 - Azure cloud open APIs

46:15 - voiceCmdr
48:15 - aurelia
48:48 - contributing to Microsoft OSS projects and docs
49:40 - Azure Portal Tipes & Tricks
50:20 - UK Cycling team story
51:42 - Microsoft Cognitive Services and Seeing AI
